content.description: Tricky leftward traverse on fins for feet and very little for hands, then jugs to a horizontal hand crack to a clean crack dihedral.
content.protection: 3 bolts, pro to 2.5", 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: On the far right side of Hell Wall (about 100 yds right of the Hell Cracks), look for a clean dihedral about 30' up. The climb starts off of a boulder with a drop off to the left, and is tightly bolted off the deck.

content.description: The right seam/crack, with overhung face climbing past 4 bolts to a crack finish. Large square-cut jugs and some routefinding, definitely not your typical AH edge-fest.
content.protection: 4 bolts, pro to 2", 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: The right seam/crack on the far left formation of the Hell Wall.

content.description: The left of the two parallel seams/cracks, named after the Mel Cracks at Josh (but here, the left is actually the left route - the Mel Cracks are reversed). Fun, steep, but delicate holds at the start with thin cams for pro.
content.protection: 4 bolts, pro to 1.5", 2-bolt anchor with mussy hooks.
content.location: The left route on the far left formation of the Hell Wall, slightly overhung with a finger crack to start.
